Key Match Events: Aaron Judge hit an RBI double and scored on Austin Wells' two-run single in the third inning.
Luis Gil allowed Chicago's only hit — Cody Bellinger's fourth-inning double — in his first big league start since August 20.
Pre-Game Insights: It was New York's first shutout since August 23 against Colorado and No. 12 on the season overall.
The Cubs lost for the third time in four games since a successful road trip put them back in the conversation for the third NL wild card.
Post-Match Reflections: It was a good day,” manager Aaron Boone said.
‘No leadoff hitters on. No multiple men on base in an inning. That’s a tough formula just to score obviously,’ manager Craig Counsell said.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Luis Gil pitched six sparkling innings in his return from a back injury.
Anthony Rizzo went 1 for 3 with a walk in his first game at Wrigley since he was traded by Chicago to New York in July 2021.
Others: Jake Cousins and Tommy Kahnle each pitched an inning for New York before Luke Weaver handled the ninth for his first career save in 199 major league appearances.
The Yankees are going with a closer-by-committee approach after Clay Holmes surrendered a game-ending grand slam in a 7-4 loss at Texas on Tuesday night.
